alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 11 at 8:44PM EDT until June 11 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Harlan County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 844 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Smith, or 8 miles south of Harlan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Cranks around 855 PM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
